.google.protobuf.ListValue.description:
`ListValue` is a wrapper around a repeated field of values.

 The JSON representation for `ListValue` is JSON array.

items.description: Repeated field of dynamically typed values.

.google.protobuf.ListValue.values.description: Repeated field of dynamically typed values.

.google.protobuf.NullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
 `Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

.google.protobuf.Struct.description:
`Struct` represents a structured data value, consisting of fields
 which map to dynamically typed values. In some languages, `Struct`
 might be supported by a native representation. For example, in
 scripting languages like JS a struct is represented as an
 object. The details of that representation are described together
 with the proto support for the language.

 The JSON representation for `Struct` is JSON object.

.google.protobuf.Struct.fields.description: Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

.google.protobuf.Value.description:
`Value` represents a dynamically typed value which can be either
 null, a number, a string, a boolean, a recursive struct value, or a
 list of values. A producer of value is expected to set one of these
 variants. Absence of any variant indicates an error.

 The JSON representation for `Value` is JSON value.

.gopencloud.gateway.AdditionalEndpointBi.description:
AdditionalEndpointBinding is an additional gRPC method - HTTP endpoint
 binding specification.

body is a request message field selector that will be read via HTTP body.

 '*' indicates that the entire request message gets decoded from the body.
 An empty string indicates that no part of the request gets decoded from the
 body.

 NOTE: Not all methods support HTTP body.

custom can be used for custom HTTP methods.

 Not all HTTP methods are supported in OpenAPI specification, however and
 will not be included in the generated OpenAPI document.

disable_query_param_discovery can be used to avoid auto binding query
 parameters.

items.description:
query_params are explicit query parameter bindings that can be used to
 rename or ignore query parameters.

.gopencloud.gateway.AdditionalEndpointBi.description:
query_params are explicit query parameter bindings that can be used to
 rename or ignore query parameters.

response_body is a response message field selector that will be written to
 HTTP response.

 '*' or an empty string indicates that the entire response message gets
 encoded.
stream holds configurations for streaming methods.

.gopencloud.gateway.Config.description: Config is the content of a configuration file.

.gopencloud.gateway.CustomPattern.description: CustomPattern describes an HTTP pattern and custom method.

.gopencloud.gateway.CustomPattern.method.description: method is the custom HTTP method.

.gopencloud.gateway.CustomPattern.path.description: path is the HTTP path pattern.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.description: EndpointBinding represents an HTTP endpoint(s) to gRPC method binding.

items.description:
additional_bindings holds additional bindings for the same gRPC service
 method.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.addi.description:
additional_bindings holds additional bindings for the same gRPC service
 method.

items.description:
aliases are additional routes for this endpoint binding.

 This field translates to additional_bindings, inheriting all values from
 endpoint binding. Consider this a syntax sugar for additional_bindings. If
 additional binding with same route and method exists, alias will not work.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.alia.description:
aliases are additional routes for this endpoint binding.

 This field translates to additional_bindings, inheriting all values from
 endpoint binding. Consider this a syntax sugar for additional_bindings. If
 additional binding with same route and method exists, alias will not work.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.body.description:
body is a request message field selector that will be read via HTTP body.

 `*` indicates that the entire request message gets decoded from the body.
 An empty string (default value) indicates that no part of the request gets
 decoded from the body.

 NOTE: Not all methods support HTTP body.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.cust.description:
custom can be used for custom HTTP methods.

 Not all HTTP methods are supported in OpenAPI specification and will not
 be included in the generated OpenAPI document.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.dele.description: delete defines route for a DELETE HTTP endpoint.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.disa.description:
disable_query_param_discovery can be used to avoid auto binding query
 parameters.

 Default: `false`

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.get.description: get defines route for a GET HTTP endpoint.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.patc.description: patch defines route for a PATCH HTTP endpoint.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.post.description: post defines route for a POST HTTP endpoint.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.put.description: put defines route for a PUT HTTP endpoint.

items.description:
query_params are explicit query parameter bindings that can be used to
 rename or ignore query parameters.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.quer.description:
query_params are explicit query parameter bindings that can be used to
 rename or ignore query parameters.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.resp.description:
response_body is a response message field selector that will be written to
 HTTP response.

 `*` or an empty string indicates that the entire response message gets
 encoded.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.sele.description:
selector is a dot-separated gRPC service method selector.

 If the selector begins with `~.`, the current proto package will be added
 to the beginning of the path. For instance: `~.MyService`. Since no proto
 package can be deduced in the global config file, this alias cannot be used
 in the global config file.

 If the selector does not begin with `~.`, it will be treated as a fully
 qualified method name (FQMN).

 NOTE: In proto annotations, this field gets automatically assigned, thus it
 is only applicable in configuration files.

.gopencloud.gateway.EndpointBinding.stre.description: stream holds configurations for streaming methods.

items.description: endpoints hold a series of endpoint binding specs.

.gopencloud.gateway.GatewaySpec.endpoint.description: endpoints hold a series of endpoint binding specs.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIEnumSpec.description:
OpenAPIEnumSpec defines configuration for generating OpenAPI documentation
 for protobuf enums.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIEnumSpec.sche.description: schema controls the OpenAPI v3.1 schema generation for this proto enum.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIEnumSpec.sele.description:
selector is a dot-separated protobuf enum selector.

 If the selector begins with a '.', it will be treated as an absolute path.
 If it begins with '~.', the current proto package will be added to the
 beginning of the path. For instance: `~.MyEnum`. Since no proto package can
 be deduced in the global config file, this alias cannot be used in the
 global config file. If the path does not begin with a '.' or '~.', it will
 be treated as a relative path and a search from the current proto package
 will be performed in order to find the enum.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIMessageSpec.description:
OpenAPIMessageSpec defines configuration for generating OpenAPI documentation
 for protobuf messages.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIMessageSpec.f.description:
fields allows controlling the OpenAPI v3.1 generation for individual fields
 in this proto message.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIMessageSpec.s.description: schema controls the OpenAPI v3.1 schema generation for this proto message.

selector is a dot-separated protobuf message selector.

 If the selector begins with a '.', it will be treated as an absolute path.
 If it begins with '~.', the current proto package will be added to the
 beginning of the path. For instance: `~.MyMessage`. Since no proto package
 can be deduced in the global config file, this alias cannot be used in the
 global config file. If the path does not begin with a '.' or '~.', it will
 be treated as a relative path and a search from the current proto package
 will be performed in order to find the message.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIServiceSpec.description:
OpenAPIServiceSpec defines configuration for generating OpenAPI documentation
 for gRPC services.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIServiceSpec.d.description:
document can be used to override default values for OpenAPI document files
 when using the option to generate OpenAPI files per service.

 Additionally, this can be used to change documentation generation behavior
 such as default responses regardless of the output generation mode.

 NOTE: This document will only be used when using output mode of "service"
 and in all other modes, this object simply gets ignored save for the config
 field. Since the config field instructs the generation of responses and the
 document objects for that service only, regardless of the output mode the
 settings will be honored.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIServiceSpec.m.description: methods maps each method to an operation configuration.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPIServiceSpec.s.description:
selector is a dot-separated gRPC service method selector.

 If the selector begins with '~.', the current proto package will be added
 to the beginning of the path. For instance: `~.MyService`. Since no proto
 package can be deduced in the global config file, this alias cannot be used
 in the global config file.

 If the selector does not begin with '~.', it will be treated as a fully
 qualified method name (FQMN).

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPISpec.description: OpenAPISpec defines the overall OpenAPI documentation configuration.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPISpec.document.description:
Document is the OpenAPI v3.1 document configuration which controls how the
 OpenAPI documentation is generated.

 This document can be defined to define a base config for all documents (if
 in the global config) or the document for the current output target. For
 instance, when using output mode of "service", each service defined in the
 associated proto file inherits this base document and can additionally
 specify more defaults for its own OpenAPI document. When defining this in
 the global config and for specific proto files, the configs get merged
 together but the priority is given to the proto document.

items.description: enums is used to configure OpenAPI v3.1 output for protobuf enums.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPISpec.enums.description: enums is used to configure OpenAPI v3.1 output for protobuf enums.

items.description: messages is used to configure OpenAPI v3.1 output for protobuf messages.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPISpec.messages.description: messages is used to configure OpenAPI v3.1 output for protobuf messages.

items.description: services is used to configure OpenAPI v3.1 output for gRPC services.

.gopencloud.gateway.OpenAPISpec.services.description: services is used to configure OpenAPI v3.1 output for gRPC services.

.gopencloud.gateway.QueryParameterBindin.description: QueryParameterBinding describes a query parameter to request message binding.
ignore avoids reading this query parameter altogether (default: false).
name is the name of the HTTP query parameter that will be used.
selector is a dot-separated path to the request message's field.

.gopencloud.gateway.StreamConfig.description: StreamConfig sets the behavior of the HTTP server for gRPC streaming methods.

.gopencloud.gateway.StreamConfig.disable.description:
disable_chunked indicates whether or not chunked transfer encoding is
 allowed.

 NOTE: Chunked transfer encoding is disabled in HTTP/2 so this option will
 only be available if the request is HTTP/1.

disable_sse indicates whether or not server-sent events are allowed.

 see:
 https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events

 SSE is only used when Accept-Type from the request includes MIME type
 text/event-stream.

disable_websockets indicates whether or not websockets are allowed for this
 method. The client must still ask for a connection upgrade.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Components.description:
Holds a set of reusable objects for different aspects of the OAS. All objects
 defined within the components object will have no effect on the API unless
 they are explicitly referenced from properties outside the components object.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#components-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Components.e.description:
items explicitly at the moment.
 extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Contact.description:
Contact information for the exposed API.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#contact-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Contact.emai.description:
The email address of the contact person/organization. This MUST be in the
 form of an email address.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Contact.exte.description:
Extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Contact.name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Contact.url.description:
The URL pointing to the contact information. This MUST be in the form of a
 URL.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Discriminato.description:
Extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

An object to hold mappings between payload values and schema names or
 references.

REQUIRED. The name of the property in the payload that will hold the
 discriminator value.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Document.description:
This is the root object of the OpenAPI document.
 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#openapi-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Document.com.description:
allowed.
 Holds a set of reusable objects for different aspects of the OAS. All
 objects defined within the components object will have no effect on the API
 unless they are explicitly referenced from properties outside the
 components object.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#components-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Document.con.description:
DocumentConfiguration is used to change the behavior of documentation
 generation such as default responses.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Document.ext.description:
extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Document.inf.description:
REQUIRED. Provides metadata about the API. The metadata MAY be used by
 tooling as required. NOTE: A generated value will be used for the required
 fields if they are left empty.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#info-object

items.description:
A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used across the API. The
 list of values includes alternative security requirement objects that can
 be used. Only one of the security requirement objects need to be satisfied
 to authorize a request. Individual operations can override this definition.
 To make security optional, an empty security requirement ({}) can be
 included in the array.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#security-requirement-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Document.sec.description:
A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used across the API. The
 list of values includes alternative security requirement objects that can
 be used. Only one of the security requirement objects need to be satisfied
 to authorize a request. Individual operations can override this definition.
 To make security optional, an empty security requirement ({}) can be
 included in the array.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#security-requirement-object

items.description:
An array of Server Objects, which provide connectivity information to a
 target server. If the servers property is not provided, or is an empty
 array, the default value would be a Server Object with a url value of /.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#server-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Document.ser.description:
An array of Server Objects, which provide connectivity information to a
 target server. If the servers property is not provided, or is an empty
 array, the default value would be a Server Object with a url value of /.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#server-object

items.description:
A list of tags used by the document with additional metadata. The order of
 the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools. Not
 all tags that are used by the Operation Object must be declared. The tags
 that are not declared MAY be organized randomly or based on the tools’
 logic. Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#tag-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Document.tag.description:
A list of tags used by the document with additional metadata. The order of
 the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools. Not
 all tags that are used by the Operation Object must be declared. The tags
 that are not declared MAY be organized randomly or based on the tools’
 logic. Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#tag-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.DocumentConf.description: DocumentConfiguration allows for controlling the default responses

default_responses is used to control the default responses generated in
 this OpenAPI document.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Encoding.description:
A single encoding definition applied to a single schema property.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#encoding-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Encoding.all.description:
Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters,
 as defined by [RFC3986] :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without
 percent-encoding. The default value is false. This property SHALL be
 ignored if the request body media type is not
 application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.
 If a value is explicitly defined, then the value of contentType (implicit
 or explicit) SHALL be ignored.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Encoding.con.description:
The Content-Type for encoding a specific property. Default value depends on
 the property type: for object - application/json; for array – the default
 is defined based on the inner type; for all other cases the default is
 application/octet-stream. The value can be a specific media type (e.g.
 application/json), a wildcard media type (e.g. image/*), or a
 comma-separated list of the two types.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Encoding.exp.description:
When this is true, property values of type array or object generate
 separate parameters for each value of the array, or key-value-pair of the
 map. For other types of properties this property has no effect. When style
 is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value
 is false. This property SHALL be ignored if the request body media type is
 not application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data. If a value is
 explicitly defined, then the value of contentType (implicit or explicit)
 SHALL be ignored.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Encoding.ext.description:
extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Encoding.hea.description:
A map allowing additional information to be provided as headers, for
 example Content-Disposition. Content-Type is described separately and SHALL
 be ignored in this section. This property SHALL be ignored if the request
 body media type is not a multipart.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Encoding.sty.description:
Describes how a specific property value will be serialized depending on its
 type. See Parameter Object for details on the style property. The behavior
 follows the same values as query parameters, including default values. This
 property SHALL be ignored if the request body media type is not
 application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.
 If a value is explicitly defined, then the value of contentType (implicit
 or explicit) SHALL be ignored.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Example.desc.description:
Long description for the example. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich
 text representation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Example.exte.description:
extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

A URI that points to the literal example. This provides the capability to
 reference examples that cannot easily be included in JSON or YAML
 documents. The value field and externalValue field are mutually exclusive.
 See the rules for resolving Relative References.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Example.ref.description:
ref is a reference to an existing example object. If used, all other fields
 in this object get ignored.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Example.valu.description:
Embedded literal example. The value field and externalValue field are
 mutually exclusive. To represent examples of media types that cannot
 naturally represented in JSON or YAML, use a string value to contain the
 example, escaping where necessary.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.ExternalDocu.description:
Allows referencing an external resource for extended documentation.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#external-documentation-object

A description of the target documentation. CommonMark syntax MAY be used
 for rich text representation.

Extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

REQUIRED. The URL for the target documentation. This MUST be in the form of
 a URL.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.FieldConfigu.description:
FieldConfiguration provides additional field level properties used when
 generating the OpenAPI v3.1 file. These properties are not defined by
 OpenAPIv3, but they are used to control the generation.

Alternative parameter name when used as path parameter. If set, this will
 be used as the complete parameter name when this field is used as a path
 parameter. Use this to avoid having auto-generated path parameter names
 for overlapping paths.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.description:
Header object follows the structure of the Parameter object with the
 following changes:
 1. name MUST NOT be specified, it is given in the corresponding headers map.
 2. in MUST NOT be specified, it is implicitly in header.
 3. All traits that are affected by the location MUST be applicable to a
 location of header (for example, style).

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#header-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.allow.description:
Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters.
 This is valid only for query parameters and allows sending a parameter with
 an empty value. Default value is false. If style is used, and if behavior
 is n/a (cannot be serialized), the value of allowEmptyValue SHALL be
 ignored. Use of this property is NOT RECOMMENDED, as it is likely to be
 removed in a later revision.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.conte.description:
A map containing the representations for the parameter.
 The key is the media type and the value describes it. The map MUST only
 contain one entry.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.depre.description:
Specifies that a parameter is deprecated and SHOULD be transitioned out of
 usage. Default value is false.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.descr.description:
A description of the link. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text
 representation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.examp.description:
Example of the parameter’s potential value.
 The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if
 present. The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field.
 Furthermore, if referencing a schema that contains an example, the example
 value SHALL override the example provided by the schema. To represent
 examples of media types that cannot naturally be represented in JSON or
 YAML, a string value can contain the example with escaping where necessary.

Examples of the parameter’s potential value. Each example SHOULD contain a
 value in the correct format as specified in the parameter encoding. The
 examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field. Furthermore, if
 referencing a schema that contains an example, the examples value SHALL
 override the example provided by the schema.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.explo.description:
When this is true, parameter values of type array or object generate
 separate parameters for each value of the array or key-value pair of the
 map. For other types of parameters this property has no effect. When style
 is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value
 is false.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.exten.description:
extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.ref.description:
ref is a reference to an existing header object. If used, all other fields
 in this object get ignored.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.requi.description:
Determines whether this parameter is mandatory.
 If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its
 value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default
 value is false.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.schem.description: The schema defining the type used for the parameter.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Header.style.description:
Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type
 of the parameter value. Default value for header parameters is "simple".

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.description:
Info captures OpenAPI Info object.
 NOTE: A generated value will be used for the required fields if they are left
 empty.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#info-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.contact.description:
The contact information for the exposed API.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#contact-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.descrip.description:
A description of the API. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text
 representation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.extensi.description:
Extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.license.description:
The license information for the exposed API.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#license-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.summary.description: A short summary of the API.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.terms_o.description:
A URL to the Terms of Service for the API. This MUST be in the form of a
 URL.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.title.description: REQUIRED. The title of the API.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Info.version.description: REQUIRED. The version of the OpenAPI document.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.License.description:
License information for the exposed API.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#license-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.License.exte.description:
Extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.License.iden.description:
An SPDX license expression for the API. The identifier field is mutually
 exclusive of the url field.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.License.name.description: REQUIRED. The license name used for the API.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.License.url.description:
A URL to the license used for the API. This MUST be in the form of a URL.
 The url field is mutually exclusive of the identifier field.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Link.description:
The Link object represents a possible design-time link for a response. The
 presence of a link does not guarantee the caller’s ability to successfully
 invoke it, rather it provides a known relationship and traversal mechanism
 between responses and other operations.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#link-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Link.descrip.description:
A description of the link. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text
 representation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Link.extensi.description:
extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Link.operati.description:
The name of an existing, resolvable OAS operation, as defined with a
 unique operationId. This field is mutually exclusive of the operationRef
 field.

 NOTE: If a path (relative or absolute) to another service method is used,
 that operation ID will be substituted. 	Example:
 ".google.protobuf.Timestamp"

A relative or absolute URI reference to an OAS operation. This field is
 mutually exclusive of the operationId field, and MUST point to an
 Operation Object. Relative operationRef values MAY be used to locate an
 existing Operation Object in the OpenAPI definition.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Link.paramet.description:
A map representing parameters to pass to an operation as specified with
 operationId or identified via operationRef. The key is the parameter name
 to be used, whereas the value can be a constant or an expression to be
 evaluated and passed to the linked operation. The parameter name can be
 qualified using the parameter location [{in}.]{name} for operations that
 use the same parameter name in different locations (e.g. path.id).

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Link.ref.description:
ref is a reference to an existing link object. If used, all other fields in
 this object get ignored.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Link.request.description:
A literal value or {expression} to use as a request body when calling the
 target operation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Link.server.description: A server object to be used by the target operation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.MediaType.description:
Each Media Type Object provides schema and examples for the media type
 identified by its key.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#media-type-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.MediaType.en.description:
A map between a property name and its encoding information. The key, being
 the property name, MUST exist in the schema as a property. The encoding
 object SHALL only apply to requestBody objects when the media type is
 multipart or application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.MediaType.ex.description:
Example of the parameter’s potential value.
 The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if
 present. The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field.
 Furthermore, if referencing a schema that contains an example, the example
 value SHALL override the example provided by the schema. To represent
 examples of media types that cannot naturally be represented in JSON or
 YAML, a string value can contain the example with escaping where necessary.

Examples of the parameter’s potential value. Each example SHOULD contain a
 value in the correct format as specified in the parameter encoding. The
 examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field. Furthermore, if
 referencing a schema that contains an example, the examples value SHALL
 override the example provided by the schema.

extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.MediaType.sc.description: The schema defining the content of the request, response, or parameter.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.description:
Describes a single API operation on a path.

 NOTE: this operation object is a partial implementation of the OpenAPI
 Operation object. Fields overridden here will only impact this method but
 will be used for all different HTTP bindings of the same method.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#operation-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.de.description:
Declares this operation to be deprecated.
 Consumers SHOULD refrain from usage of the declared operation. Default
 value is false.

A verbose explanation of the operation behavior. CommonMark syntax MAY be
 used for rich text representation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.ex.description:
extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

Additional external documentation for this operation.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#external-documentation-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.op.description: Override the operation ID, if left unset, a default value will be provided.

items.description:
A list of parameters that are applicable for this operation. Note that path
 and query parameters get populated by the generator and will override any
 overlapping keys.

 You might use this to define headers and values that are not defined on the
 request payload.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.pa.description:
A list of parameters that are applicable for this operation. Note that path
 and query parameters get populated by the generator and will override any
 overlapping keys.

 You might use this to define headers and values that are not defined on the
 request payload.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.re.description:
The list of possible responses returned from executing this operation.

 NOTE: This list is additive meaning that it will override any generated
 response from the proto files.

items.description:
A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used for this operation.
 The list of values includes alternative security requirement objects that
 can be used. Only one of the security requirement objects need to be
 satisfied to authorize a request. To make security optional, an empty
 security requirement ({}) can be included in the array. This definition
 overrides any declared top-level security. To remove a top-level security
 declaration, an empty array can be used.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.se.description:
A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used for this operation.
 The list of values includes alternative security requirement objects that
 can be used. Only one of the security requirement objects need to be
 satisfied to authorize a request. To make security optional, an empty
 security requirement ({}) can be included in the array. This definition
 overrides any declared top-level security. To remove a top-level security
 declaration, an empty array can be used.

items.description:
An alternative server array to service this operation.
 If an alternative server object is specified at the Path Item Object or
 Root level, it will be overridden by this value.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.se.description:
An alternative server array to service this operation.
 If an alternative server object is specified at the Path Item Object or
 Root level, it will be overridden by this value.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.su.description:
A short summary of what the operation does.

 Default is the proto docstring for this method.

items.description:
A list of tags for API documentation control.
 Tags can be used for logical grouping of operations by resources or any
 other qualifier.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Operation.ta.description:
A list of tags for API documentation control.
 Tags can be used for logical grouping of operations by resources or any
 other qualifier.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.OperationCon.description:
Set 2xx if your endpoint returns > 200 and < 300 http code (e.g. 201
 accepted). Default response, if enabled, will have specified code. Default:
 "200"

Disable default error response at operation level.
 Not necessary, if similar plugin option enabled globally

Disable default response at operation level.
 Not necessary, if similar plugin option enabled globally

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.description:
Describes a single operation parameter.
 A unique parameter is defined by a combination of a name and location.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#parameter-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.al.description:
Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters.
 This is valid only for query parameters and allows sending a parameter with
 an empty value. Default value is false. If style is used, and if behavior
 is n/a (cannot be serialized), the value of allowEmptyValue SHALL be
 ignored. Use of this property is NOT RECOMMENDED, as it is likely to be
 removed in a later revision.

Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters, as
 defined by [RFC3986]
 :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without percent-encoding.
 This property only applies to parameters with an in value of query. The
 default value is false.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.co.description:
A map containing the representations for the parameter.
 The key is the media type and the value describes it. The map MUST only
 contain one entry.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.de.description:
Specifies that a parameter is deprecated and SHOULD be transitioned out of
 usage. Default value is false.

A description of the link. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text
 representation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.ex.description:
Example of the parameter’s potential value.
 The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if
 present. The example field is mutually exclusive of the examples field.
 Furthermore, if referencing a schema that contains an example, the example
 value SHALL override the example provided by the schema. To represent
 examples of media types that cannot naturally be represented in JSON or
 YAML, a string value can contain the example with escaping where necessary.

Examples of the parameter’s potential value. Each example SHOULD contain a
 value in the correct format as specified in the parameter encoding. The
 examples field is mutually exclusive of the example field. Furthermore, if
 referencing a schema that contains an example, the examples value SHALL
 override the example provided by the schema.

When this is true, parameter values of type array or object generate
 separate parameters for each value of the array or key-value pair of the
 map. For other types of parameters this property has no effect. When style
 is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value
 is false.

extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.in.description:
REQUIRED. The location of the parameter. Possible values are "query",
 "header", "path" or "cookie".

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.na.description:
REQUIRED. The name of the parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive.
 If in is "path", the name field MUST correspond to a template expression
 occurring within the path field in the Paths Object. See Path Templating
 for further information. If in is "header" and the name field is "Accept",
 "Content-Type" or "Authorization", the parameter definition SHALL be
 ignored. For all other cases, the name corresponds to the parameter name
 used by the in property.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.re.description:
ref is a reference to an existing parameter object. If used, all other
 fields in this object get ignored.

Determines whether this parameter is mandatory.
 If the parameter location is "path", this property is REQUIRED and its
 value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default
 value is false.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.sc.description: The schema defining the type used for the parameter.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Parameter.st.description:
Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type
 of the parameter value. Default value for header parameters is "simple".

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Reference.description:
Reference allows referencing other components in the OpenAPI document, both
 internally and externally. For detailed information on the Reference object,
 refer to the OpenAPI Specification:
 https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#reference-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Reference.de.description:
A description that, by default, SHOULD override that of the referenced
 component. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation. If
 the referenced object-type does not allow a description field, then this
 field has no effect.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Reference.su.description:
A short summary that, by default, SHOULD override that of the referenced
 component. If the referenced object-type does not allow a summary field,
 then this field has no effect.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Reference.ur.description:
REQUIRED. The reference identifier. This MUST be in the form of a URI.
 For proto messages, a fully qualified message name can be used (relative
 links are allowed where proto file is deduced).

 Example: ".google.protobuf.Timestamp"

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.RequestBody.description:
Describes a single request body.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#request-body-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.RequestBody..description:
REQUIRED. The content of the request body. The key is a media type or media
 type range and the value describes it. For requests that match multiple
 keys, only the most specific key is applicable. e.g. text/plain overrides
 text/*

A brief description of the request body. This could contain examples of
 use. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

ref is a reference to an existing request body object. If used, all other
 fields in this object get ignored.

Determines if the request body is required in the request. Defaults to
 false.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Response.con.description:
A map containing descriptions of potential response payloads.
 The key is a media type or media type range and the value describes it.
 For responses that match multiple keys, only the most specific key is
 applicable. e.g. text/plain overrides text/*

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Response.des.description:
A description which by default SHOULD override that of the referenced
 component. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation. If
 the referenced object-type does not allow a description field, then this
 field has no effect.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Response.ext.description:
extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Response.hea.description:
Maps a header name to its definition. [RFC7230] states header names are
 case insensitive. If a response header is defined with the name
 "Content-Type", it SHALL be ignored.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Response.lin.description:
A map of operations links that can be followed from the response. The key
 of the map is a short name for the link, following the naming constraints
 of the names for Component Objects.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Response.ref.description:
ref is a reference to an existing response object. If used, all other
 fields in this object get ignored.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.description:
Schema represents an OpenAPI v3.1 Schema object, providing a structured
 definition for data types used in the API.

 For detailed information on the Schema object, refer to the OpenAPI
 Specification: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#schema-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.Item.description:
Represents an item in a SchemaList, which can be a schema or another
 SchemaList.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.Schem.description: Represents a list of schemas for array validation or for object properties.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.addit.description:
The additionalProperties keyword specifies the schema for additional
 properties in an object.

items.description:
The allOf keyword specifies that an instance must validate against all the
 schemas defined in the array.

 See: https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-core#name-allof

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.all_o.description:
The allOf keyword specifies that an instance must validate against all the
 schemas defined in the array.

 See: https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-core#name-allof

items.description:
The anyOf keyword specifies that an instance must validate against at least
 one of the schemas defined in the array.

 See: https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-core#name-anyof

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.any_o.description:
The anyOf keyword specifies that an instance must validate against at least
 one of the schemas defined in the array.

 See: https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-core#name-anyof

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.confi.description: Configuration related to schema generation for OpenAPI documentation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.defau.description:
The default keyword provides a default JSON value associated with the
 schema.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.depre.description:
The deprecated keyword specifies that the schema is deprecated.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-9.3

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.descr.description: A description of the schema using CommonMark syntax.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.discr.description:
Adds support for polymorphism by specifying a discriminator object name
 that differentiates between schemas.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#discriminator-object

items.description:
An array of unique values for enum validation.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.1.2

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.enum.description:
An array of unique values for enum validation.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.1.2

items.description:
Examples of valid instances for the schema.

 See:
 https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-validation#section-9.5

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.examp.description:
Examples of valid instances for the schema.

 See:
 https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-validation#section-9.5

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.exter.description:
Additional external documentation related to this schema.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#external-documentation-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.extra.description:
Extra can be used to add any other field in the schema. Since OpenAPI v3.1
 arbitrary fields can be used in the schema objects. This field can be
 utilized to add those extra fields. Some of the JSON schema validation
 properties or core properties that are not captured as part of the gRPC
 REST Gateway OpenAPI objects.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.forma.description:
The format keyword specifies a predefined format for the schema value.

 See: https://json-schema.org/draft-06/json-schema-validation#rfc.section.8

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.items.description: The items keyword specifies the schema for items in an array.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.max_i.description:
An array instance is valid against "maxItems" if its size is
 less than, or equal to, the value of this keyword.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.4.1

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.max_l.description:
A string instance is valid against this keyword if its length is
 less than, or equal to, the value of this keyword.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.3.1

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.maxim.description:
Maximum represents an inclusive upper limit for a numeric instance. The
 value of MUST be a number, representing an inclusive upper limit for a
 numeric instance.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.2.2

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.min_i.description:
An array instance is valid against "minItems" if its size is
 greater than, or equal to, the value of this keyword.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.4.2

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.min_l.description:
A string instance is valid against this keyword if its length is
 greater than, or equal to, the value of this keyword.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.3.2

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.minim.description:
minimum represents an inclusive lower limit for a numeric instance. The
 value of MUST be a number, representing an inclusive lower limit for a
 numeric instance.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.2.4

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.multi.description:
The value of "multipleOf" MUST be a number, strictly greater than 0.
 A numeric instance is valid only if division by this keyword's value
 results in an integer.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.2.1

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.not.description:
The not keyword specifies that an instance must not validate against the
 schema defined.

 See: https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-core#name-not

items.description:
The oneOf keyword specifies that an instance must validate against exactly
 one of the schemas defined in the array.

 See: https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-core#name-oneof

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.one_o.description:
The oneOf keyword specifies that an instance must validate against exactly
 one of the schemas defined in the array.

 See: https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-core#name-oneof

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.patte.description:
A regular expression pattern that the schema value should match.
 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.3.3

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.prope.description:
The properties keyword specifies the schema for properties in an object.

 Defining any property here for proto messages merges them with the
 automatically generated ones.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.read_.description:
The readOnly keyword specifies that a property is read-only.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-9.4

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.ref.description:
Ref is used to define an external reference to include in the message.
 This could be a fully qualified proto message reference and start with a
 '.', and that type must be available in the proto files or their
 dependencies. If no message is identified, the Ref will be used verbatim in
 the output.

 For example:
  `ref: ".google.protobuf.Timestamp"`.

 NOTE: This reference will only be honored when used in top-level schemas in
 responses only.

items.description: A list of property names that are required in this schema.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.requi.description: A list of property names that are required in this schema.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.schem.description:
The "$schema" keyword is used to identify the schema dialect and its
 associated URI for validation.

 See:
 https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/json-schema-core#name-the-schema-keyword

items.description:
Indicates what type this schema holds. In JSON schema draft 2020, this can
 be a singular value or a list of values. For simplicity of structure, types
 is always a list but if it contains only one item, in the generated file,
 it will be a single string and not a list.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.types.description:
Indicates what type this schema holds. In JSON schema draft 2020, this can
 be a singular value or a list of values. For simplicity of structure, types
 is always a list but if it contains only one item, in the generated file,
 it will be a single string and not a list.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.uniqu.description: If set to true, all items must be unique.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Schema.write.description:
The writeOnly keyword specifies that a property is write-only.

 See:
 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-bhutton-json-schema-validation-00#section-9.4

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.SchemaDataTy.description: Enum for the data type of a schema.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.SecurityRequ.description:
Lists the required security schemes to execute this operation.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#security-requirement-object

Each name MUST correspond to a security scheme which is declared in the
 Security Schemes under the Components Object. If the security scheme is of
 type "oauth2" or "openIdConnect", then the value is a list of scope names
 required for the execution, and the list MAY be empty if authorization does
 not require a specified scope. For other security scheme types, the array
 MAY contain a list of role names which are required for the execution, but
 are not otherwise defined or exchanged in-band.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.SecuritySche.description:
Defines a security scheme that can be used by the operations.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#security-scheme-object

Configuration details for a supported OAuth Flow

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#oauth-flow-object

extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

Configuration for the OAuth Authorization Code flow. Previously called
 accessCode in OpenAPI 2.0.

Configuration for the OAuth Client Credentials flow. Previously called
 application in OpenAPI 2.0.

extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions
Configuration for the OAuth Implicit flow
Configuration for the OAuth Resource Owner Password flow

A hint to the client to identify how the bearer token is formatted.
 Bearer tokens are usually generated by an authorization server,
 so this information is primarily for documentation purposes.

A brief description of the request body. This could contain examples of
 use. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

REQUIRED. An object containing configuration information for the flow types
 supported.

REQUIRED. The location of the API key. Valid values are "query", "header"
 or "cookie".
REQUIRED. The name of the header, query or cookie parameter to be used.

REQUIRED. OpenId Connect URL to discover OAuth2 configuration values.
 This MUST be in the form of a URL. The OpenID Connect standard requires the
 use of TLS.

ref is a reference to an existing response object. If used, all other
 fields in this object get ignored.

REQUIRED. The name of the HTTP Authorization scheme to be used in the
 Authorization header as defined in [RFC7235].
 The values used SHOULD be registered in the IANA Authentication Scheme
 registry.

REQUIRED. The type of the security scheme.
 Valid values are "apiKey", "http", "mutualTLS", "oauth2", "openIdConnect".

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Server.description:
An object representing a Server.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#server-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Server.descr.description:
An optional string describing the host designated by the URL.
 CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Server.exten.description:
Extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Server.url.description:
REQUIRED. A URL to the target host. This URL supports Server Variables and
 MAY be relative, to indicate that the host location is relative to the
 location where the OpenAPI document is being served. Variable substitutions
 will be made when a variable is named in {brackets}.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Server.varia.description:
A map between a variable name and its value. The value is used for
 substitution in the server’s URL template.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.ServerVariab.description:
An object representing a Server Variable for server URL template
 substitution.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#server-variable-object

REQUIRED. The default value to use for substitution, which SHALL be sent if
 an alternate value is not supplied. Note this behavior is different than
 the Schema Object’s treatment of default values, because in those cases
 parameter values are optional. If the enum is defined, the value MUST exist
 in the enum’s values.

An optional description for the server variable.
 CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

items.description:
An enumeration of string values to be used if the substitution options are
 from a limited set. The array MUST NOT be empty.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.ServerVariab.description:
An enumeration of string values to be used if the substitution options are
 from a limited set. The array MUST NOT be empty.

Extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Tag.description:
Adds metadata to a single tag that is used by the Operation Object.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#tag-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Tag.descript.description:
A description for the tag. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text
 representation.

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Tag.extensio.description:
Extensions that start with "x-" such as "x-foo" used to describe extra
 functionality that is not covered by standard OpenAPI specification.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#specification-extensions

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Tag.external.description:
Additional external documentation for this tag.

 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0#external-documentation-object

.gopencloud.gateway.openapi.Tag.name.description: REQUIRED. The name of the tag.
